turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Kees Stip.
turn.1: What's the deal with Kees Stip?
turn.2: A large collection of poems by Trijntje Fop appeared in 1988 as "Het Grote Beestenfeest" ("The Large Animalparty").
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The animal poems are of a very consistent pattern.
turn.5: What do you mean by that?
turn.6: Never any smuggling with the Metre (poetry): every line, without exception, has four stresses.
turn.7: What else is consistent about it?
turn.8: The rhyme scheme is always AABBCC (an epigram or paired rhyme).
turn.10: Just like a limerick, somewhere in the verse, often in the first line, the name of a town is mentioned.
turn.11: Is there anything else that is interesting?
turn.12: Most Trijntje Fop verses contain six lines; occasionally, it will be eight lines, and every now and then an even higher number of lines.
